results.title: Afraid of school: a case of school phobia (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Disordered Mind”.
Tommy, aged six, refuses to go to school and is obsessed with thoughts of death and dying. After bribery, persuasion and spanking, his desperate parents seek psychiatric help at a children’s hospital. Both Tommy and his parents receive counselling, and learn to come to grips with his going to school. Psychiatrist: Taylor Statten, MD.

results.title: Hello
results.brief_description: ‘Hello’ is it me you’re looking for?’ A wildly imaginative love story about love across the digital-analogue divides. Can an almost obsolete cassette head speak the language of love with only fast forward and rewind to work with?

results.title: Afghanistan: the land of crags and deserts
results.brief_description: This film, without narration, includes various aspects of life in Afghanistan. Shows mosques, markets, women in chaderi, camel caravan watering sheep in a desert area, the game of buzkashi a form of polo which uses a headless goat, and examples of weaving and dancing.

results.title: Screen magazine. No. 16
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This is the United Nations”
The people of Afghanistan have followed a way of life that has changed very little in the past thousand years. In 1950 the Afghanistan Government, which has been making efforts to develop and improve the country, called upon the U.N. to help by providing technical assistance. This film describes how new knowledge and techniques have been introduce into industry and agriculture, resulting in increasing output and development of resources.

results.title: Aetna: a volcanic eruption on the island of Sicily
results.brief_description: Records, un-narrated, with only a descriptive jazz score, the basic stages of an eruption of Mount Aetna, on the east coast of Sicily. It gives a non-verbal picture of one of the most dramatic of natural events, and is also an indirect portrait of Aetna itself.

results.title: Aerial fencing
results.brief_description: With the opening up of new pastures in New Zealand many hundreds of miles of new fencing were required; aircraft which have been previously employed in distributing fertilizers, were used to drop fencing posts and wire. The materials were carried in racks under the wings of the planes and deposited in the areas required.
